title: Bayesian Hypothesis Testing
contentHtml:
In Bayesian hypothesis testing, we update our prior beliefs about a statistical model based on new data. This approach is particularly useful when dealing with complex models or uncertain priors.

The key concept is the Bayes factor, which measures the relative support for one model over another given the observed data.
intuition: Think of it like updating your prior odds of a coin being fair or biased based on the results of multiple flips.
realWorldApplications: Comparing the performance of different machine learning models
commonMistakes: Failing to account for model uncertainty in hypothesis testing

subject: statistics
title: Bayesian Hypothesis Testing
contentHtml:
Bayesian hypothesis testing is a powerful approach to statistical inference that's gaining popularity in machine learning and artificial intelligence.

In traditional frequentist statistics, we test hypotheses using p-values and confidence intervals. In contrast, Bayesian methods update our beliefs about the world based on new data, incorporating prior knowledge and uncertainty.
intuition: Think of Bayesian hypothesis testing as updating your mental model of the world based on new data. You start with a prior belief, and then update it using the likelihood of the data given the hypothesis.
visualDescription: A diagram showing a probability distribution shifting towards a new mean after incorporating new data
commonMistakes: Confusing Bayes' factor with posterior odds
Ignoring the importance of prior knowledge
realWorldApplications: Comparing the performance of different machine learning models using Bayesian model selection

subject: statistics
title: Bayesian Hypothesis Testing
contentHtml: Bayesian hypothesis testing is a powerful framework for making informed decisions in the presence of uncertainty. Given a null and alternative hypothesis, we can update our prior beliefs using Bayes' theorem to obtain the posterior probability.
intuition: Think of Bayesian hypothesis testing as updating your prior beliefs based on new data. You start with a certain level of skepticism or confidence in each hypothesis, and then use the data to adjust those beliefs.
realWorldApplications: Comparing the performance of different machine learning models
commonMistakes: Failing to account for the prior distribution
Ignoring the complexity of the model
